qas.question: How many years after VHS was LaserDisk released?
Under what name was LaserDisc originally marketed?
How did the first viewers refer to the media?

context: LaserDisc was first available on the market, in <a0_0>Atlanta, Georgia<a0_0/>, on December 15, 1978, <a1_0>two years<a1_0/> after the introduction of the VHS VCR, and four years before the introduction of the CD (which is based on laser disc technology). Initially licensed, sold, and marketed as <a2_0>MCA DiscoVision<a2_0/> (also known as simply "DiscoVision") in North America in 1978, the technology was previously referred to internally as Optical Videodisc System, Reflective Optical Videodisc, Laser Optical Videodisc, and Disco-Vision (with a dash), with the first players referring to the format as <a3_0>"Video Long Play"<a3_0/>.
